盡.definition: to use up; to exhaust; to end; to finish; to the utmost; exhausted; finished; to the limit (of sth); all; entirely

盡人皆知.definition: known by everyone (idiom); well known; a household name

盡力.definition: to strive one's hardest; to spare no effort

盡力而為.definition: to try one's utmost; to strive

盡可能.definition: see 儘可能|尽可能[jin3 ke3 neng2]

盡善盡美.definition: perfect (idiom); perfection; the best of all possible worlds; as good as it gets

盡地主之誼.definition: to act as host; to do the honors

盡失.definition: (of hope, appetite, authority etc) to be lost

盡展.definition: to display (one's potential, one's talents etc)

盡心盡力.definition: making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out; to do one's utmost

盡心竭力.definition: to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost

盡忠.definition: to display utter loyalty; to be loyal to the end

盡性.definition: displaying fully; developing to the greatest extent

盡意.definition: to express fully; all one's feelings

盡收眼底.definition: to take in the whole scene at once; to have a panoramic view

盡數.definition: in its entirety; all of it; all of them

盡歡而散.definition: to disperse after a happy time (idiom); everyone enjoys themselves to the full then party breaks up

盡皆.definition: all; without exception; complete; whole; entirely

盡義務.definition: to fulfill one's duty; to work without asking for reward

盡興.definition: to enjoy oneself to the full; to one's heart's content

盡言.definition: saying everything; to speak out fully

盡責.definition: to do one's duty; to do one's bit conscientiously

盡量.definition: as much as possible; to the greatest extent

盡飽.definition: to be stuffed to the gills; to eat to satiety
